item.title: How to make a shaded relief in R
item.description: Spanish version of this post While trying to build a circular colour scale to plot angles and wind direction, I stumbled upon an easy way to make shaded reliefs in R. You known, when you look at cool maps of mountain areas where peaks and valleys are easily distinguishable from their shadows like this: What I accidentally discovered is that one way of approximating this look is by taking the directional derivatives of height and then plotting the cosine of its angle from the sun.
